title: What are the most forgotten cars that were very common years ago? - Quora

response.answer_text: You only have to go back to the 1970s and ‘80s to see some very common cars which have all but disappeared today! The Ford Pinto and Maverick, the Chevrolet Vega and Chevette, the Dodge Omni and Plymouth Horizon… all built to be entry-level/economy cars, and now so rare that most millennials wouldn’t recognize any of them! Most only know what an AMC Pacer is because of the movie “Wayne’s World”! Much less the AMC Gremlin… How about a Plymouth Sapporo? A Dodge 600? A Plymouth Reliant? A Oldsmobile Omega or Pontiac Phoenix? A Chevrolet Citation or a Ford Probe? Does anyone remember (or mourn) the Ford Fairmont? All gone, and pretty much forgotten…

K-cars from Chrysler, Dodge and Plymouth. Pintos. Pacers, the 6000 and 6000LE from Pontiac, the Chevrolet Celebrity, they Hyundai Pony, and then the Monte Carlo, Cutlass, Buick Regal, Grand National, the Camaro and even the Firebird, just to name a few.
